fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`XOR AL, imm8`
`XOR AX, imm16`
`XOR EAX, imm32`
`XOR RAX, imm32`
`XOR r/m8, imm8`
`XOR r/m8*, imm8`
`XOR r/m16, imm16`
`XOR r/m32, imm32`
`XOR r/m64, imm32`
`XOR r/m16, imm8`
`XOR r/m32, imm8`
`XOR r/m64, imm8`
`XOR r/m8, r8`
`XOR r/m8*, r8*`
`XOR r/m16, r16`
`XOR r/m32, r32`
`XOR r/m64, r64`
`XOR r8, r/m8`
`XOR r8*, r/m8*`
`XOR r16, r/m16`
`XOR r32, r/m32`
`XOR r64, r/m64`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Performs a bitwise exclusive OR (XOR) operation on the destination (first) and source (second) operands and stores the result in the destination operand location. The source operand can be an immediate, a register, or a memory location; the destination operand can be a register or a memory location. (However, two memory operands cannot be used in one instruction.) Each bit of the result is 1 if the corresponding bits of the operands are different; each bit is 0 if the corresponding bits are the same.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: This instruction can be used with a LOCK prefix to allow the instruction to be executed atomically.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: In 64-bit mode, using a REX prefix in the form of REX.R permits access to additional registers (R8-R15). Using a REX prefix in the form of REX.W promotes operation to 64 bits. See the summary chart at the beginning of this section for encoding data and limits.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
